TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1372
TEI.2.document_title: William Laughlin to Stephen F. Austin, 07-15-1826

barker_notes.barker_summary: William Laughlin to Austin, July 15, 1826. Judicial procedure. Resistance to an officer.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1372

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*William Laughlin to Austin, July 15, 1826. Judicial procedure. Resistance to an officer.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*District Of San jacinto*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**date_mentioned n="07-18-1826">July the 15th 1826*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**location_mentioned*Department of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Austins Colony*/location_mentioned**/p* *p*To the *person_mentioned*Honble Stephen F. Austin Judge of the Supreme Court of the *location_mentioned*Colony*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* aforesaid the petition of *person_mentioned*William Laughlin*/person_mentioned* respectfully represents that he your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*received an attachmen[t| from your Honor dated *date_mentioned n="05-23-1826">May the 23d 1826*/date_mentioned* in favour of *person_mentioned*John D. Taylor*/person_mentioned* against *person_mentioned*John Kenny*/person_mentioned* which your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*levyed in parte on the *date_mentioned n="05-31-1826">31st of May*/date_mentioned* on *location_mentioned**person_mentioned*Diver*/person_mentioned*s property*/location_mentioned* of said *person_mentioned*Kenny */person_mentioned*(viz) Two Cows and two yearlings and one Calf and sundry other property (viz) a number of Books and one Gold watch etc. all by the direction of said *person_mentioned*Taylor*/person_mentioned*—your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*having received your late instructions of the *date_mentioned n="07-12-1826">12 of July*/date_mentioned* took said *person_mentioned*Kenny*/person_mentioned*s Bond and Security for his appearance before the *person_mentioned*Alcalde */person_mentioned*at his return to his *location_mentioned*District */location_mentioned*and your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*went to the *location_mentioned*House of said *person_mentioned*Taylor*/person_mentioned**/location_mentioned* and he uterly refused to give them up declaring at the same time that they were in his possession and he would keep them till the suit was decided And after some dissagreeable conversation the Said *person_mentioned*Taylor */person_mentioned*went into his *location_mentioned*House*/location_mentioned* and came out with a loaded musket in his hand and ordered the said *person_mentioned*Kenny */person_mentioned*off his *location_mentioned*premises */location_mentioned*with many threats and swore at the same time that he would give the first man the contents of his musket that would attempt to enter his *location_mentioned*cowpen */location_mentioned*to turn out said*person_mentioned* Kenny*/person_mentioned*s Calvs therefore your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*was prevented from discharging the dutys of his office according to your order. Your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*prays that your Honor will assist him in inforcing the laws and your *person_mentioned*petitioner */person_mentioned*as in Duty Bound will ever pray*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Wm Laughlin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Const [able]*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
